title.narrative: Well prepared Red Cross CAR for disaster response

description.narrative: RP-II aims at 1. Functioning contingency plans for selected areas. 2. Sufficient DM staff and volunteers are trained and available for response. 3. Adequate response infrastructure. 4. strong network to provide and improve its emergency response. 5. Adopted innovative response mechanisms (eg. FbF, CTP). 6. sufficient capacity built to perform core functions in emergency response

The country is prone to natural (climate) disasters and man-made disasters (conflict). CRCA is active in national, regional and local disaster response and has a DM unit but has received little support on RP whereas capacity building is needed to ensure nationwide coverage. Impact of core RP activities can be high, considering the small, but highly dedicated National Society.
This cooperation with IFRC aims at improving Central African Red Cross Society and communities affected by disasters.
This project supports the Red Cross Society Central African Republic (CRCA) to enhance their emergency response capacity in selected regions.

sector.narrative: Civil unrest and other situations of violence
Multisector aid for basic social services

title.narrative: Admin staff trained
RP - Policy, Strategy and Standards
At the end of the programme, the 05 National Societies have a score of at least 3 (minimal compliance) on 5 key DM components that were selected during the baseline (DRCE)
RP - Operational support
CDRTs are trained and equipped to handle local response in partnership with relevant local actors

comment.narrative: baseline study was conducted in April may 2017 by field team ( CRCA/NLRC) to provide relevant and up-to-date background information at local committee level to complement RP2 base line study conducted in October 2016 CDRT/NDRT: CRCA has currently three NDRT members, trained in 2009, and therefore not a full team. No refresher training has been conducted since.
200 CDRT trained 79 NDRT in 29 comittees over 77 trained to respond to the main hazards (ENA, first aid, water rescue, RFL, emergency operational center/room, etc.) as appropriate.
200 CDRT trained 79 NDRT in 29 comittees over 77 trained to respond to the main hazards (ENA, first aid, water rescue, RFL, emergency operational center/room, etc.) as appropriate.

title.narrative: RP - Coordination
